articles.title: Fossils from China show new species of extinct giant rhino that roamed Asia - India Today
articles.description: Giant rhinos like the newly discovered species, named Paraceratherium linxiaense, were hornless, long-necked herbivores.
articles.content: Fossils found in northwest China's Gansu province indicate a new species of giant rhino that lived more than 26 million years ago, according to a paper published in the journal Communications Biology… [+693 chars]

articles.title: China fossils show new species of extinct giant rhino that roamed Asia - TODAYonline
articles.description: BEIJING -     Fossils found in northwest China's Gansu province indicate a new species of giant rhino that lived more than 26 million years ago, according to a paper published in the journal Communications Biology on Thursday.
